cards.name: Kapurimon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While you have a Tamer in play, this Digimon gets +1000 DP.
ruling: Q: Do Tamers of any color make the effect of this card's active?
A: Yes. No colour is specified, so you can activate it regardless of the colour of Tamer you have in play.

cards.name: Bukamon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When you play a Digimon from one of your Digimon's digivolution cards, gain 1 memory.

cards.name: Pusurimon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] When this card is trashed due to activating this Digimon's <Digi-Burst>, 1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -1000 DP for the turn.
ruling: Q: Which activates first: This card's Inherited Effect, or the effect that activates when you trash this card with <Digi-Burst>?
A: The <Digi-Burst> effect activates first.

cards.name: Koromon
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] Reveal the top card of your deck, and place it at the top or bottom of your deck.
engsets: Digimon Card Game Fest - Digi-Egg Set

cards.name: Dorimon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When one of your effects places a digivolution card under this Digimon, <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck).
ruling: Q: When one of my effects digivolves a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, does this card’s inherited effect activate?
A: No. When a Digimon digivolves, even if it happens due to an effect, it is not counted as an effect placing digivolution cards under that Digimon.
Q: If one of my effects places 2 or more cards at the same time under a Digimon that has this card's inherited effect, can I draw that many cards?
A: No. Even if multiple cards are added to the Digimon’s digivolution cards, if they were added by a single effect, you only draw 1 card.

cards.name: Kokomon
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] You may reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Trash 1 Tamer card among them. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
ruling: Q: If there are Tamer cards among the cards revealed with this card's inherited effect, do I have to trash 1 of them?
A: Yes. You can choose whether or not to reveal cards from your deck, but if any Tamer cards are revealed among the cards, you must trash 1 of them.

cards.name: Flamemon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Add 1 card with [Hybrid] in its traits, [Susanoomon], or [Takuya Kanbara] among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
cards.effect2: [On Deletion] You may play 1 [Takuya Kanbara] from your hand without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Huckmon
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] (Once Per Turn) Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Add all cards with [Sistermon] in their name among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Tuskmon
cards.effect1: [When Digivolving] 1 of your Digimon gets +2000 DP for the turn.

cards.name: BurningGreymon
cards.effect1:
You may digivolve this card from your hand onto one of your red Tamers as if the Tamer is a level 3 red Digimon for a memory cost of 2.
[When Digivolving] If a card with [Hybrid] in its traits or [Takuya Kanbara] is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less.
ruling: Q: When this Digimon digivolves onto a Tamer card, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?
A: No, it doesn’t.
Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 3 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: After a Tamer card ends up in this Digimon's digivolution cards, is that card affected by effects that trash digivolution cards?
A: Yes, it is. However, if the effect specifies that it trashes Digimon cards, DigiEgg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't affect Tamer cards.
Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?
A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.
Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?
A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn
Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?
A: It is trashed.
Q: Does this card have [Greymon] in its name?
A: No. This card's Japanese name (ヴリトラモン) does not have "Greymon" (グレイモン) in its name.
Q: If I digivolve my dual-coloured Red-Green Tamer into this card, can I use the effect of [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered!]?
A: No, this card's effect treats the tamer as a pure Red Digimon, so it is not counted as green.

cards.name: MetalGreymon
cards.effect1: [On Play] If you have a Tamer in play, gain 2 memory. If you don't have a tamer, you may play 1 red Tamer card from your hand without paying its memory cost.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When one of your opponent's Digimon is deleted, gain 1 memory.
ruling: Q: If I play this card while I have no Tamers in play, and play a red Tamer from my hand with this card's effect, do I then also gain 2 memory from this effect since I now have a Tamer in play?
A: No. If you play this card with no Tamers in play, you only get to play 1 red Tamer card from your hand.
Q: If I delete 2 or more of my opponent’s Digimon at the same time, does this card’s inherited effect allow me to gain 1 memory for each Digimon deleted?
A: No. Even if multiple Digimon are deleted, if they were deleted by a single effect, you only gain 1 memory.

cards.name: Aldamon
cards.effect1:
When one of your Digimon with a Tamer card in its digivolution cards digivolves into this card in your hand, reduce the memory cost of the digivolution by 2.
[When Digivolving] If a card with [Hybrid] in its traits is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, this Digimon gets +4000 DP for the turn.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While this Digimon has [Hybrid], or [Ten Warriors] in its traits, it doesn't activate [Security] effects on Option cards it checks.
ruling: Q: When a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards performs a security check, if the checked card is a Digimon card or a Tamer card, does its [Security] effect activate?
A: Yes. All [Security] effects on non-Option cards activate normally.

cards.name: AvengeKidmon
cards.jpname: アヴェンジキッドモン
cards.effect1:
When playing this card from your hand, reduce its memory cost by 1 for each Option card in you and your opponent's trashes.
[On Play] Return all cards with [Three Musketeers] in their traits and all Option cards from both players' trashes to the bottom of their owners' decks. If 7 or more cards were returned using this effect, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with [Three Musketeers] in its traits or 8000 DP or less.
ruling: Q: Is this card’s play cost reduced by 1 for each Option card in ONLY my trash or my opponent’s trash?
A: No, its play cost is reduced by the total number of Option cards in both you and your opponent's trashes.
Q: I use this card’s [On Play] effect to return cards from both players’ trashes to the bottom of their owners’ decks. Who decides which order the cards are placed in?
A: The owners of the cards get to decide the order the cards are placed in when they return to the bottom of their decks.

cards.name: EmperorGreymon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] <Blitz> (If your opponent has 1 or more memory, this Digimon may attack).
[Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When this Digimon is blocked, unsuspend it, and gain 1 memory for each digivolution card this Digimon has with [Hybrid] in its traits.
ruling: Q: I attack with this Digimon, and it is blocked by an opponent's Digimon at the reaction timing. My opponent has another "when an opponent's Digimon attacks" effect that is still pending activation. Does that effect activate before this card's [Your Turn] effect?

A: This card's effect activates first. The [Your Turn] effect is triggered by your opponent activating <Blocker> to block this Digimon's attack. Because <Blocker> is a reaction timing effect, that means the [Your Turn] effect is triggered after reaction timing effects have been triggered. According to the rules, effects that were triggered later have activation priority, so the [Your Turn] effect activates first.

cards.name: Chaosdramon
cards.effect1:
Your [Machinedramon] can digivolve into this card in your hand for a memory cost of 1, ignoring this card's digivolution requirements.
[When Digivolving] You may place 1 red or black level 5 card with [Cyborg] in its traits from your hand or trash on top of this card's digivolution cards to delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 6000 DP or less for each level 5 card with [Cyborg] in its traits  in this Digimon's digivolution cards.
ruling: Q: Can I place 1 red or black level 5 card with [Cyborg] in their traits in its traits from my hand or trash on top of this Digimon's digivolution cards with this card's [When Digivolving] effect even if my opponent has no Digimon with 6000 DP or less in play?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Gomamon
cards.effect1: [On Play] When played from digivolution cards, <Draw 2> (Draw 2 cards from your deck).
ruling: Q: A Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is targeted with <De-Digivolve> by my opponent, resulting in this card now being the Digimon’s top card. Do I draw 2 cards with this card's [On Play] effect?
A: No. Having this card become a Digimon as a result of <De-Digivolve> doesn’t count as playing it, so you can’t draw any cards.

cards.name: Strabimon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Add 1 card with [Hybrid] in its traits, [Susanoomon], or [Koji Minamoto] among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
cards.effect2: [On Deletion] You may play 1 [Koji Minamoto] from your hand without paying its memory cost.

cards.effect1:

cards.effect1:
You may digivolve this card from your hand onto one of your blue Tamers as if the Tamer is a level 3 blue Digimon for a memory cost of 2.
[When Digivolving] If a card with [Hybrid] in its traits or [Tommy Himi] is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, 1 of your opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards can't attack or block until the end of their next turn.
ruling: Q: When this Digimon digivolves onto a Tamer card, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?

Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?
A: It is trashed.
Q: When this card's [When Digivolving] effect prevents a Digimon from attacking or blocking, if that Digimon gains a digivolution card afterwards, can it attack or block?
A: No. Once a Digimon is targeted by this card's [When Digivolving] effect, it becomes unable to attack or block until the end of your opponent’s turn, even if it gains a digivolution card.
Q: If I digivolve my dual-coloured Blue-Green Tamer into this card, can I use the effect of [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered!]?
A: No, this card's effect treats the tamer as a pure Blue Digimon, so it is not counted as green.

cards.name: DaiPenmon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] For each Digimon your opponent has with no digivolution cards, <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck).
[Opponent's Turn] While a card with [Hybrid] in its traits is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, none of your opponent's level 3 Digimon can attack.

cards.name: Beowolfmon
cards.effect1:
When one of your Digimon with a Tamer card in its digivolution cards digivolves into this card in your hand, reduce the memory cost of the digivolution by 2.
[When Attacking] You may return 1 card with [Hybrid] in its traits from this Digimon's digivolution cards to your hand to return 1 of your opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon to its owner's hand. Trash all of the digivolution cards of that Digimon.

cards.name: WereGarurumon
cards.effect1: [On Play] If you have a Tamer in play, gain 2 memory. If you don't have a Tamer in play, you may play 1 blue Tamer card from your hand without paying its memory cost.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When this Digimon becomes unsuspended during your main phase, gain 1 memory.
ruling: Q: If I play this card while I have no Tamers in play, and play a blue Tamer from my hand with this card's effect, do I then also gain 2 memory from this effect since I now have a Tamer in play?
A: No. If you play this card with no Tamers in play, you only get to play 1 blue Tamer card from your hand.

cards.name: Whamon
cards.effect1: [On Play] You may play 1 level 3 Digimon card from one of your Digimon's digivolution cards as another Digimon without paying its memory cost. If you do, you may place 1 blue Digimon card from your hand at the bottom of one of your Digimon's digivolution cards.
ruling: Q: This card's [On Play] effect places a Digimon card from my hand under 1 of my Digimon. Can I place it under this Digimon?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: This card's [On Play] effect plays a level 3 Digimon card from the digivolution cards of a suspended Digimon. Does the level 3 Digimon enter play suspended?
A: No. It enters play as a new Digimon, unsuspended. Additionally, it does not carry over any effects on the source Digimon.

cards.name: KingWhamon
cards.effect1:
[When Attacking] You may play 1 level 3 Digimon card or 1 [Whamon] from this Digimon's digivolution cards as another Digimon without paying its memory cost.
[Your Turn] When you play a Digimon from one of your Digimon's digivolution cards, return 1 of your opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon to its owner's hand. Trash all of the digivolution cards of that Digimon.
ruling: Q: One of my Digimon with digivolution cards is targeted by my opponent’s <De-Digivolve>, resulting in it becoming one of the Digimon in its digivolution cards. When this happens, can I return 1 of my opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon to its owner's hand with this card's [Your Turn] effect?
A: No. Having a digivolution card become a Digimon as a result of <De-Digivolve> does not count as playing that card, so this card's [Your Turn] effect does not trigger.

cards.name: MagnaGarurumon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] [When Attacking] (Once Per Turn) You may return 1 card with [Hybrid] in its traits from this Digimon's digivolution cards to your hand to return 1 of your opponent's Digimon with the same level as the returned card to its owner's hand. Trash all of the digivolution cards of that Digimon.
[Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When an effect adds a card to your hand, you may unsuspend 1 of your Digimon.
ruling: Q: This card has an effect that activates at both [When Digivolving] and [When Attacking] timings. What does this mean, exactly?

A: It means the effect can be activated both [When Digivolving] and [When Attacking]. You can activate it as a [When Digivolving] effect when you digivolve this Digimon, then activate it again on following turns as a [When Attacking] effect by attacking with this Digimon.
Q: This card has a [When Digivolving][When Attacking](Once Per Turn) effect, but can I activate it twice in the same turn by both digivolving and attacking?

A: No. No matter which timing the effect is triggered at, it is still the same effect and can only be activated (Once Per Turn). If the effect has been triggered at [When Digivolving] and activated, it can not be activated again on the same turn, even if it's triggered [When Attacking].
Q: Will this card's [Your Turn] effect activate when my Digimon is returned to my hand?
A: Yes, it does.
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect activate when a card effect allows you to draw and trash card from your hand?
A: Yes, it will activate.
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect activate if my card effect performs a digivolution and draws from its digivolution bonus?
A: No, it is not treated as drawing from an effect.

cards.name: AncientMegatheriummon
cards.jpname: エンシェントメガテリウモン
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] For each card with [Hybrid] in its traits in this Digimon's digivolution cards, trash 1 digivolution card from the bottom of each of your opponent's Digimon. Then, for each Digimon your opponent has with no digivolution cards, <Draw 2> (Draw 2 cards from your deck).
[On Deletion] You may play 1 blue level 4 or lower Digimon card with [Hybrid] in its traits from your hand without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Herissmon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] When this card is trashed due to activating this Digimon's <Digi-Burst>, return this card to its owner's hand.
ruling: Q: I trash this card from a Digimon's digivolution cards to activate <Digi-Burst>. Do I return this card to its owner's hand before or after the <Digi-Burst> effect activates?
A: Return this card to its owner’s hand after <Digi-Burst> activates.

cards.name: Pulsemon

cards.name: Bulkmon

・1 of your opponent's Digimon gains <Security Attack -2> (This Digimon checks 2 fewer security cards) until the end of your opponent's next turn.

A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Stefilmon
cards.effect1: [When Digivolving] If this Digimon has 1 digivolution card, you may place up to 2 level 4 or lower yellow Digimon cards from your hand at the bottom of this Digimon's digivolution cards in any order. Then, <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck) for each Digimon card you placed.

cards.name: Rasenmon
cards.effect1:
When digivolving into this card from your hand, the memory cost of the digivolution is equal to the number of cards in your security stack. If you have 0 security cards, the memory cost is 1.
[Main] (Once Per Turn) <Digi-Burst up to 4> (You may trash up to 4 of this Digimon's digivolution cards to activate the effect below)
・1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -3000 DP for the turn for each card trashed by this card's effect.
ruling: Q: When digivolving into this card from my hand, I activate an effect on another card that reduces digivolution costs. What happens to this card’s digivolution cost?

A: The digivolution cost is equal to the number of cards in your security stack minus the amount reduced by the effect. If you have 4 security cards and activate an effect that reduces digivolution costs by 2, the final digivolution cost will be 2. (4 minus 2.)
Q: This card’s <Digi-Burst up to> reads “up to 4.” Can I activate the effect if I have 3 or fewer digivolution cards?

A: Yes, you can. This card's <Digi-Burst up to 4> allows you to choose any number of digivolution cards to trash, from 1 to 4. If you have 3 or fewer digivolution cards, you can activate the effect as long as you can trash 1 or more of them.
Q: I trash 2 digivolution cards to activate this card's <Digi-Burst up to>. Can I have 2 of my opponent's Digimon both get -3000 DP?
A: No, this effect can only target 1 of your opponent's Digimon.
Q: Can I digivolve into this card for 4 cost or less even if my opponent has [BT5-021 Syakomon]?
A: Yes, this card's effect sets the digivolution cost. It does not reduce.

cards.name: Kazuchimon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] If you have 3 or more security cards, gain 2 memory. If you have 2 or fewer security cards, you may <Recovery +1 (Deck)> (Place the top card of your deck on top of your security stack) until there are 3 cards in your security stack.
[Your Turn] While you have 3 or more security cards, this Digimon gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card).
ruling: Q: I activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect when I have 2 or fewer security cards to go up to 3 security cards with <Recovery +1 (Deck)>. Do I now gain 2 memory for being at 3 or more security cards?
A: No. If you digivolve into this card while at 2 or fewer security cards, you only go up to 3 security cards with <Recovery +1 (Deck)>.

cards.name: AncientKazemon
cards.jpname: エンシェントイリスモン
cards.effect1:
[Opponent's Turn] While a card with [Hybrid] in its traits is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, all of your Security Digimon get +4000 DP.
[On Deletion] You may play 1 yellow level 4 or lower card with [Hybrid] in its traits from your hand without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Gotsumon
cards.effect1: [On Play] You may reveal 1 green Digimon card from your hand. If you do, place it on top of your deck.

cards.name: Betamon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Add 1 green level 4 Digimon card or 1 green Tamer card among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Tortomon
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] You may reveal 1 green Digimon card from your hand and place it on top of your deck to have this Digimon get +3000 DP for the turn.

cards.name: Beetlemon
cards.effect1:
You may digivolve this card from your hand onto one of your green Tamers as if the Tamer is a level 3 green Digimon.
[When Digivolving] Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Add 1 card with [Hybrid] in its traits and 1 [J.P. Shibayama] among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
ruling: Q: When this Digimon digivolves onto a Tamer card, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?
A: No, it doesn’t.
Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 3 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: After a Tamer card ends up in this Digimon's digivolution cards, is that card affected by effects that trash digivolution cards?
A: Yes, it is. However, if the effect specifies that it trashes Digimon cards, DigiEgg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't affect Tamer cards.
Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?
A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.
Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?
A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn
Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?
A: It is trashed.

Q: I reveal 5 cards with this card's [When Digivolving] effect. If the cards revealed only include either a card with [Hybrid] in its traits in its traits or [J.P. Shibayama], can I still add a card to my hand?
A: Yes. Even if you revealed only a card with [Hybrid] in its traits in its traits or [J.P. Shibayama], you still add that card to your hand.
Q: If I digivolve on top of a tamer with this effect can I use the effect of [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered] to reduce the memory cost?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: Can I suspend the tamer for the effect of [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered] to reduce the memory cost?
A: No, you cannot. You must suspend another Digimon in the Battle Area.
Q: If I digivolve my dual-coloured Red-Green Tamer into this card, if I use the effect of [EX1-071 Win Rate 60%]. Can I discard a Red Digimon card?
A: No, this card's effect treats the tamer as a pure Green Digimon, so it is not counted as Red.

cards.name: MetalKabuterimon
cards.effect1:
You may digivolve this card from your hand onto one of your green Tamers as if the Tamer is a level 3 green Digimon for a memory cost of 2.
[When Digivolving] If a card with [Hybrid] in its traits or [J.P. Shibayama] is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 6000 DP or less.
ruling: Q: When this Digimon digivolves onto a Tamer card, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?
A: No, it doesn’t.
Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 3 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: After a Tamer card ends up in this Digimon's digivolution cards, is that card affected by effects that trash digivolution cards?
A: Yes, it is. However, if the effect specifies that it trashes Digimon cards, DigiEgg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't affect Tamer cards.
Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?
A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.
Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?
A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn
Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?
A: It is trashed.
Q: Does this card have [Kabuterimon] in its name?
A: No. This card's Japanese name (ボルグモン) does not have "Kabuterimon" (カブテリモン) in its name.
Q: Can I suspend the tamer for the effect of [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered] to reduce the memory cost?
A: No, you cannot. You must suspend another Digimon in the Battle Area.
Q: If I digivolve my dual-coloured Red-Green Tamer into this card, if I use the effect of [EX1-071 Win Rate 60%]. Can I discard a Red Digimon card?
A: No, this card's effect treats the tamer as a pure Green Digimon, so it is not counted as Red.

cards.name: MameTyramon
cards.effect1: [When Attacking] Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. You may digivolve this Digimon into a green level 6 card among them without paying its memory cost. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
ruling: Q: I digivolve into a green level 6 Digimon with this card's [When Attacking] effect. Can I activate that Digimon’s [When Attacking] effects?
A: No. It is too late to trigger those [When Attacking] effects because it did not have them when the attack was declared.
Q: When attacking, do I have to reveal 3 cards from my deck with this card’s [When Attacking] effect?
A: Yes, the effect is mandatory. You reveal as many cards as you can, up to 3.
Q: If a green level 6 Digimon card is among the cards revealed with this card’s [When Attacking] effect, do I have to digivolve into it?
A: No. The effect reads, “You may digivolve,” so you can choose not to.
Q: If 2 or more green level 6 Digimon cards are among the cards revealed with this card’s [When Attacking] effect, can I choose either card to digivolve into?
A: Yes, you can digivolve into the Digimon of your choosing.
Q: When digivolving with this card’s [When Attacking] effect, do I draw a card as a digivolution bonus?
A: Yes, you do.

cards.name: RhinoKabuterimon
cards.effect1:
When one of your Digimon with a Tamer card in its digivolution cards digivolves into this card in your hand, reduce the memory cost of the digivolution by 2.
[When Attacking] If a card with [Hybrid], or [Insectoid] in its traits is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, this Digimon can digivolve into a Digimon card with [Insectoid], or [Ten Warriors] in its traits in your hand for a memory cost of 3.
ruling: Q: I have a card with [Hybrid], or [Insectoid] in its traits in this Digimon's digivolution cards. Does this card’s [When Attacking] effect force me to digivolve this Digimon into a Digimon card with [Insectoid], or [Ten Warriors] in its traits in my hand?
A: No. The effect reads, “This Digimon can digivolve,” so you can choose not to.
Q: When digivolving with this card's [When Attacking] effect, paying the digivolution cost moves the memory gauge to 1 or more on my opponent’s side. What happens to the attack?

A: The attack continues. The turn doesn’t switch over just yet. If the memory gauge is still at 1 or more on your opponent’s side after the attack ends and any effects triggered by it finish activating, only then does the turn switch over.
Q: I attack with [EX1-035 Kabuterimon] and digivolve into this card with its [When Attacking] effect. Can I then digivolve again on the same attack with this card's [When Attacking] effect?
A: No, it is too late to trigger this card's [When Attacking] effect, since the Digimon didn't have it when the attack was declared.

Q: When digivolving into a Digimon card in my hand with [Insectoid], or [Ten Warriors] in its traits in its traits with this card's [When Attacking] effect, can I ignore that card's digivolution requirements?
A: No, you can’t ignore its digivolution requirements.
Q: If I am using this card's [When Attacking] effect to digivolve, can I reduce its digivolution cost of that effect?
A: Yes, you can reduce the digivolution cost of 3 with another effect.

cards.name: SaberLeomon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] This Digimon gets +5000 DP for the turn.
[On Deletion] Gain 2 memory.

cards.name: Dinorexmon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] Suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon. That Digimon doesn't unsuspend during their next unsuspend phase.
[Your Turn] This Digimon gets +1000 DP for each of your opponent's suspended Digimon.
ruling: Q: Using this card's [When Digivolving] effect, can I prevent my opponent's Digimon from becoming unsuspended during my opponent's next unsuspend phase by applying this effect to it while it's suspended?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: AncientBeetlemon
cards.jpname: エンシェントビートモン
cards.effect1:
[Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When one of your Digimon with [Ten Warriors], or [Hybrid] in their traits deletes an opponent's Digimon in battle and survives, trash the top card of your opponent's security stack.
[On Deletion] You may play 1 green level 4 or lower Digimon card with [Hybrid] in its traits from your hand without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Ebonwumon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] Suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon. Then, gain 1 memory for each of your opponent's suspended Digimon.
[Opponent's Turn] All of your opponent's Digimon gain “[Your Turn] You must trash 1 card in your hand to unsuspend this Digimon.”
ruling: Q: My opponent unsuspends 2 or more of their Digimon. Does this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect allow my opponent to unsuspend all of their Digimon by trashing 1 card in their hand?
A: No. Your opponent must trash 1 card in their hand for each Digimon they unsuspend.
Q: If an effect causes an opponent’s Digimon to unsuspend, does this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect force my opponent to trash a card in their hand?
A: Yes. If anything causes an opponent’s Digimon to unsuspend, whether it’s an effect or your opponent’s unsuspend phase, your opponent must trash a card in their hand to unsuspend it.
Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. If I have 3 suspended Digimon in play, do I need to have 3 or more cards in hand during my unsuspend phase in order to unsuspend my Digimon?

A: No, you can choose which of your Digimon to unsuspend, and trash a card in your hand for each one. Digimon will not unsuspend unless you choose to trash a card in your hand, so even if you have fewer cards in hand than suspended Digimon in play, you can still choose to unsuspend specific Digimon.
Q: Does this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect require my opponent to trash cards in their hand to also unsuspend their Tamer cards?
A: No. This effect only affects Digimon. Your opponent can unsuspend their Tamers normally, without trashing cards in their hand.
Q: I have two of these Digimon in play. Does my opponent have to trash 2 cards in their hand for each Digimon they want to unsuspend?

A: Yes. Your opponent’s Digimon now have two copies of “[Your Turn] You must trash 1 card in your hand to unsuspend this Digimon” on them, which means they have to trash 2 cards in their hand to unsuspend 1 of their Digimon.
Q: If it would be mandatory to unsuspend a Digimon, is it mandatory to trash a card from your hand?
A: No, it is not mandatory. You can choose not to trash a card, but the Digimon will remain suspended.

Q: If my opponent trashes a card with the effect of "when this card is trashed from your hand by one of your effects" for the [Your Turn] effect of this card, when does it activate during the unsuspend phase?

A: It will only activate after all Digimon affected by this card's [Your Turn] effect have unsuspended. So your opponent trashes all of their cards first before unsuspending all the Digimon that were not prevented from unsuspending, only after the Digimon have unsuspended will the "when this card is trashed from your hand" effects activate. (For more information see Effect Resolution)

Q: If my opponent is unsuspending by an effect and I have this card in play. My opponent trashes a card with "when this card is trashed from hand" for the [Your Turn] effect of this card. When does that effect activate?
A: It will only trigger after the effect has fully resolved along with other effects triggered by the currently resolving effect. (For more information see Effect Resolution)
Q: If I also have a Digimon with <Reboot> and my opponent has suspended Tamers, what order does every card unsuspend during the Unsuspend Phase?

A: After your opponent finishes trashing cards from their hand for each Digimon they want to unsuspend, all of their Digimon, Tamers, and your Digimon with <Reboot> will be unsuspended at the same time.

cards.name: Dorumon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Add 1 card with [X Antibody] in its traits and 1 [Kota Domoto] among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When one of your effects places a digivolution card under this Digimon, gain 1 memory.
ruling: Q: I reveal 3 cards with this card's [On Play] effect. If the cards revealed only include either a card with [X Antibody] in their traits in its traits or [Kota Domoto], can I still add a card to my hand?
A: Yes. Even if you revealed only a card with [X Antibody] in their traits in its traits or [Kota Domoto], you still add that card to your hand.
Q: When one of my effects digivolves a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, does this card’s inherited effect activate?
A: No. When a Digimon digivolves, even if it happens due to an effect, it is not counted as an effect placing digivolution cards under that Digimon.
Q: If one of my effects places 2 or more cards at the same time under a Digimon that has this card's inherited effect, do I gain that much memory?
A: No. Even if multiple cards are added to the Digimon’s digivolution cards, you only gain 1 memory.
Q: When this card is placed in one of my Digimon’s digivolution cards, does this card’s inherited effect activate?
A: Yes, it does.

cards.name: Monitamon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Add 1 card with [Knightmon], or [DeadlyAxemon] in its name among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.

cards.name: SkullKnightmon
cards.effect1: [When Attacking] You may digivolve this Digimon into a [DarkKnightmon] in your hand without paying its memory cost by placing 1 of your [DeadlyAxemon] at the bottom of this Digimon's digivolution cards.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While this Digimon has [Knightmon], or [Bagramon] in its name, it gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card).
ruling: Q: Can this card's [When Attacking] effect place one of my [DeadlyAxemon] with no digivolution cards at the bottom of this Digimon’s digivolution cards?
A: Yes, you can choose a [DeadlyAxemon] with no digivolution cards with this effect.
Q: If I activate this card's effect to trash a digivolution card from my [DeadlyAxemon]. Does this trigger the effect of my opponent's [BT8-029 Frozomon]?
A: No, this card's effect to trash digivolution cards is considered reminder text, so it does not trigger.

cards.name: DeadlyAxemon
cards.jpname: デッドリーアックスモン
cards.effect1: [On Play] Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Add up to 2 cards with [Knightmon] in their name among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While this Digimon has [Knightmon], or [Bagramon] in its name,  it gets +2000 DP.

cards.name: Dorugamon
cards.effect1: [Opponent's Turn] While you have another Digimon in play with [X Antibody] in its traits, or a card with [X Antibody] in its traits is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, this Digimon gains <Blocker> (When an opponent's Digimon attacks, you may suspend this Digimon to force the opponent to attack it instead).
cards.effect2: [All Turns] While this Digimon has [X Antibody] in its traits, it gets +1000 DP.

cards.name: DarkKnightmon
cards.effect1:
[On Play] You may place 1 [SkullKnightmon] and/or 1 [DeadlyAxemon] from your hand and/or trash in this Digimon's digivolution cards in any order.
[All Turns] When this Digimon would be deleted, you may play 1 [SkullKnightmon] and/or 1 [DeadlyAxemon] from this Digimon's digivolution cards suspended without paying their memory costs.
ruling: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect place cards in this Digimon's digivolution cards if I don’t have both a [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] in either my hand or trash?
A: Yes. You don't have to place both a [SkullKnightmon] and a [DeadlyAxemon]. You can also place either of them on their own from either your hand or trash in this Digimon's digivolution cards.
Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect place a [SkullKnightmon] in my hand and a [DeadlyAxemon] in my trash in this Digimon’s digivolution cards?
A: Yes. You can mix and match [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] from both your hand and trash to place in this Digimon’s digivolution cards.
Q: If I have both [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] in this Digimon’s digivolution cards, does this card’s [All Turns] effect require me to play both?
A: No. The effect reads, “you may,” so you can choose whether to play them. Choosing to play one or the other is up to you.
Q: When does this card's [All Turns] effect activate?

A: This card's [All Turns] effect triggers at the same time as <Decoy>. So it activates before the Digimon has been deleted. Its effect does not prevent its own deletion but you can use <Decoy> after this card's effect to protect it from deletion.
Q: My opponent plays [BT6-105 Geralt Schwärmer] and I use this card's effect to play [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] from its digivolution cards. Do those Digimon also get deleted?
A: No, the Digimon that were played are not deleted.
Q: If my Digimon has already an effect applied that says it "can't be deleted", does this card's [All Turns] still trigger?
A: No, it does not trigger as it was not about to be deleted.

cards.name: DoruGreymon
cards.effect1: [When Digivolving] You may place 1 black card with [X Antibody] in its traits from your hand at the bottom of this Digimon's digivolution cards to prevent effects from deleting it or reducing its DP until the end of your opponent's next turn.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn]  While this Digimon has [X Antibody] in its traits, it gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card).
ruling: Q: Does this card have [Greymon] in its name?
A: No. This card's Japanese name (ドルグレモン) does not have "Greymon" (グレイモン) in its name.

cards.name: Dorugoramon
cards.effect1:
[Your Turn] For each card with [X Antibody] in its traits in this Digimon's digivolution cards, this Digimon gets +1000 DP.
[When Attacking] (Once Per Turn) You may place 1 card with [X Antibody] in its traits from your hand at the bottom of this Digimon's digivolution cards to delete up to 2 of your opponent's Digimon with play costs less than or equal to this Digimon's digivolution cards.

cards.name: AncientVolcanomon
cards.jpname: エンシェントボルケーモン
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] <De-Digivolve  3> on 1 of your opponent's Digimon (Trash up to 3 cards from the top of one of your opponent's Digimon. If it has no digivolution cards, or becomes a level 3 Digimon, you can't trash any more cards) 
[On Deletion] You may play 1 black level 4 or lower card with [Hybrid] in its traits from your hand without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Lopmon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When you play a Tamer, gain 1 memory.

cards.name: Eyesmon: Scatter Mode
cards.jpname: アイズモン：スキャッターモード
cards.effect1: [On Deletion] <Draw 3> (Draw 3 cards from your deck). Then, trash 2 cards in your hand.

cards.name: Wendigomon
cards.effect1: [When Digivolving] You may reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Trash all Tamer cards among them. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When you play a Tamer, <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck).
ruling: Q: Can I choose not to activate this card’s [When Digivolving] effect when digivolving?
A: Yes. The effect reads, “You may,” so you can choose not to activate it. However, after revealing a card from your deck, you must perform the rest of the effect to the best of your ability.
Q: If Tamer cards are among the 5 cards revealed by this card’s [When Digivolving] effect, am I required to trash them?
A: Yes. Once you choose to reveal cards, you must trash all Tamer cards you reveal.

cards.name: Loweemon

Q: After a Tamer card ends up in this Digimon's digivolution cards, is that card affected by effects that trash digivolution cards?
A: Yes, it is. However, if the effect specifies that it trashes Digimon cards, DigiEgg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't affect Tamer cards.
Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?
A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.
Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?
A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn
Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?
A: It is trashed.
Q: If I digivolve my dual-coloured Purple-Green Tamer into this card, can I use the effect of [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered!]?
A: No, this card's effect treats the tamer as a pure Purple Digimon, so it is not counted as green.

cards.name: Eyesmon
cards.effect1:
When  you trash this card in your hand using one of your effects, if  [Eyesmon: Scatter Mode] is in your trash, you may play this card  without paying its memory cost. 
[Your Turn] For each [Eyesmon: Scatter Mode] in your trash,  this Digimon gets +2000 DP.
ruling: Q: I don’t have [Eyesmon: Scatter Mode] in my trash. If I trash both this card and [Eyesmon: Scatter Mode] in my hand with an effect, can I play this card?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: I discard this card from the [Your Turn] effect of [BT7-055 Ebonwumon]. If this card is suspended by the effect of [BT4-060 Lotosmon] can it still unsuspend during the Unsuspend Phase?
A: No, this Digimon was not on the field at the time your Digimon would unsuspend from the Unsuspend Phase.

cards.name: KaiserLeomon
cards.effect1:
You may digivolve this card from your hand onto one of your purple Tamers as if the Tamer is a level 3 purple Digimon for a memory cost of 2.
[When Digivolving] If a card with [Hybrid] in its traits or [Koichi Kimura] is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, this Digimon gains <Retaliation> (When this Digimon is deleted after losing a battle, delete the Digimon it was battling) until the end of your opponent's next turn.
ruling: Q: When this Digimon digivolves onto a Tamer card, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?
A: No, it doesn’t.
Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 3 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: After a Tamer card ends up in this Digimon's digivolution cards, is that card affected by effects that trash digivolution cards?
A: Yes, it is. However, if the effect specifies that it trashes Digimon cards, DigiEgg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't affect Tamer cards.
Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?
A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.
Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?
A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn
Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?
A: It is trashed.
Q: If I digivolve my dual-coloured Purple-Green Tamer into this card, can I use the effect of [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered!]?
A: No, this card's effect treats the tamer as a pure Purple Digimon, so it is not counted as green.

cards.name: Antylamon
cards.effect1: [When Digivolving] You may play 1 purple Tamer card with a play cost of 3 or less from your trash without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Rhihimon
cards.effect1:
When one of your Digimon with a Tamer card in its digivolution cards digivolves into this card in your hand, reduce the memory cost of the digivolution by 2.
[On Deletion] If a card with [Hybrid] in its traits is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, you may play 1 purple Tamer card from your trash without paying its memory cost.
ruling: Q: A purple Tamer card is in this Digimon’s digivolution cards. If this Digimon is deleted, can its [On Deletion] effect play that purple Tamer card from my trash without paying its memory cost?
A: Yes, it can.
Q: If this card is deleted with only 1 Digimon card [Hybrid] in its traits, if that Digimon card [Hybrid] in its traits leaves the Trash. Can this card's [On Deletion] effect activate?
A: Yes, it can activate. The Digimon only considers its situation prior to its deletion.

cards.name: Orochimon
cards.effect1: When you trash this card in your hand using one of your effects, <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck).
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] (Once Per Turn) You may trash 1 card in your hand to gain 1 memory.

cards.name: Nidhoggmon
cards.effect1:
When you trash this card in your hand using one of your effects, gain 1 memory. 
[When Digivolving] You may trash 1 card in your hand to delete 1 of your opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon.

cards.name: AncientSphinxmon
cards.jpname: エンシェントスフィンクモン
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] You may delete 1 of your Digimon with [Ten Warriors] or [Hybrid] in its traits to delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon whose level is less than or equal to the deleted Digimon's level.
[On Deletion] You may play 1 purple level 4 or lower card with [Hybrid] in its traits from your hand without paying its memory cost.
ruling: Q: Can I delete this card itself with its [When Digivolving] effect to delete 1 of my opponent's level 6 or lower Digimon?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Cherubimon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] You may play 1 purple Tamer card from your trash without paying its memory cost. Then, for each Tamer you have in play, delete 1 of your opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon.
[On Deletion] For each Tamer you have in play, you may play 1 level 3 Digimon card from your trash without paying its memory cost.
ruling: Q: I do not play a purple Tamer card from my trash with this card’s [When Digivolving] effect. Does the “for each Tamer you have in play, delete 1 of your opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon” part of the effect activate?
A: Yes. Even if you don’t play a Tamer from your trash, everything following “Then,” still activates.
Q: Can I attempt to delete less Digimon than the number of Tamers in play?
A: No, if there is a valid target and you have not deleted equal to the number of Tamers you must delete that target.

cards.name: Neemon
cards.effect1:
[On Play] You may play 1 Tamer card with an inherited effect from your hand without paying its memory cost.
[All Turns] (Once Per Turn) When one of your Digimon with a Tamer card in its digivolution cards is deleted, you may play 1 Tamer card from your trash without paying its memory cost.
ruling: Q: A Tamer card is in a Digimon’s digivolution cards. If that Digimon is deleted, can this card's [All Turns] effect play the Tamer card that used to be in that Digimon’s digivolution cards from my trash without paying its memory cost?
A: Yes, it can.

cards.name: Bokomon
cards.effect1:
[On Play] Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Add 1 card with [Hybrid], or [Ten Warriors] in its traits and 1 Tamer card among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
[Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When one of your Tamers digivolves, gain 2 memory.
ruling: Q: I reveal 5 cards with this card's [On Play] effect. If the cards revealed only include either a card with [Hybrid], or [Ten Warriors] in its traits or a Tamer card, can I still add a card to my hand?
A: Yes. Even if you revealed only a card with [Hybrid], or [Ten Warriors] in its traits or a Tamer card, you still add that card to your hand.

cards.name: Sistermon Blanc (Awakened)
cards.jpname: シスタモン ブラン（覚醒）
cards.effect1:
[On Play] You may place 1 [Sistermon Blanc] from your hand or trash at the bottom of this Digimon's digivolution cards to <Recovery +1 (Deck)> (Place the top card of your deck on top of your security stack).
[On Deletion] Return 1 card with [Jesmon], [Huckmon], or [Sistermon] in its name other than [Sistermon Blanc (Awakened)] from your trash to your hand.
ruling: Q: Can I place a [Sistermon Blanc (Awakened)] from my hand or trash at the bottom of this Digimon's digivolution cards with this card's [On Play] effect?
A: No, you can't. This effect can only place [Sistermon Blanc].
Q: Can this card's [On Deletion] effect return [BaoHuckmon], [SaviorHuckmon], or [Sistermon Ciel (Awakened)] from my trash to my hand?
A: Yes. Those cards have [Huckmon], or [Sistermon] in their name in their names, so you can add one of them to your hand.

cards.name: Sistermon Ciel (Awakened)
cards.jpname: シスタモン シエル（覚醒）
cards.effect1:
[On Play] You may place 1 [Sistermon Ciel] from your hand or trash at the bottom of this Digimon's digivolution cards to delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 5 or less.
[On Deletion] Return 1 card with [Jesmon], [Huckmon], or [Sistermon] in its name other than [Sistermon Ciel (Awakened)] from your trash to your hand.
ruling: Q: Can I place a [Sistermon Ciel (Awakened)] from my hand or trash at the bottom of this Digimon's digivolution cards with this card's [On Play] effect?
A: No, you can't. This effect can only place [Sistermon Ciel].
Q: Can this card's [On Deletion] effect return [BaoHuckmon], [SaviorHuckmon], or [Sistermon Blanc (Awakened)] from my trash to my hand?
A: Yes. Those cards have [Huckmon], or [Sistermon] in their name, so you can add one of them to your hand.

cards.name: Eosmon
cards.effect1:
[Your Turn] All of your other [Eosmon] get +1000 DP.
[On Deletion] You may play 1 level 5 or lower [Eosmon] from your hand without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Takuya Kanbara
cards.effect1:
[Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.
[Main] (Once Per Turn) You may digivolve this card into an [EmperorGreymon] in your hand for its digivolution cost as if this card is a level 5 red Digimon by placing 5 cards with [Hybrid] in their traits from your trash under this Tamer in any order.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] This Digimon gets +2000 DP. While this Digimon has 10000 DP or more, this Digimon gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card).
ruling: Q: How do I activate this card’s inherited effect?

A: Some Digimon cards can digivolve onto Tamers. Digivolve such a Digimon onto this card, and it will become part of that Digimon’s digivolution cards, allowing you to activate this card’s inherited effect.
Q: Can I activate this card's [Main] effect to place 5 cards with [Hybrid] in their traits under this Tamer from my trash, and then choose not to digivolve into [EmperorGreymon]?

A: Yes. The card text reads, "you may," so you can choose to only place 5 cards with [Hybrid] in their traits under this Tamer without digivolving.The effect is a "do <X> to <Y>", <X> can be done even if you can't do <Y> (don't have an [EmperorGreymon]). However, as the hand is a private area, you are not required to verify if you have an EmperorGreymon or not.
Q: If I only have 4 cards in my trash with [Hybrid] in their traits, can I activate this card's [Main] effect to place 4 cards from my trash under this Tamer without digivolving?
A: No, you can’t.
Q: Does this card's "as if this Tamer is a level 5 red Digimon." apply even if you choose not to digivolve?
A: No, this card's "as if this Tamer is a level 5 red Digimon." only applies if you are using its effect to digivolve into [EmperorGreymon]. It does not keep applying afterwards.

cards.name: Tommy Himi
cards.effect1:
[Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.
[On Play] Trash 3 digivolution cards from the bottom of 1 of your opponent's Digimon.
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] (Once Per Turn) Until the end of your opponent's next turn, 1 of your opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards can't attack or block.
ruling: Q: How do I activate this card’s inherited effect?

A: Some Digimon cards can digivolve onto Tamers. Digivolve such a Digimon onto this card, and it will become part of that Digimon’s digivolution cards, allowing you to activate this card’s inherited effect.
Q: When this card's [When Attacking] effect prevents a Digimon from attacking or blocking, if that Digimon gains a digivolution card afterwards, can it attack or block?
A: No. Once a Digimon is targeted by this card's inherited effect, it becomes unable to attack or block until the end of your opponent’s turn, even if it gains a digivolution card.

cards.name: Koji Minamoto
cards.effect1:
[Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.
[Main] (Once Per Turn) You may digivolve it into a [MagnaGarurumon] in your hand for its digivolution cost as if this Tamer is a level 5 blue Digimon by placing 5 cards with [Hybrid] in their traits from your hand under this Tamer in any order.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When an effect adds a card to your hand, gain 1 memory. Then, this Digimon can't be blocked for the turn.
ruling: Q: How do I activate this card’s inherited effect?

A: Some Digimon cards can digivolve onto Tamers. Digivolve such a Digimon onto this card, and it will become part of that Digimon’s digivolution cards, allowing you to activate this card’s inherited effect.
Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when an opponent's effect returns one of my Digimon to its owner's hand?
A: Yes, it does.
Q: Can I activate this card's [Main] effect to place 5 cards with [Hybrid] in their traits under this Tamer from my hand, and then choose not to digivolve into [MagnaGarurumon]?

A: Yes. The card text reads, "you may," so you can choose to only place 5 cards with [Hybrid] in their traits under this Tamer without digivolving.The effect is a "do <X> to <Y>", <X> can be done even if you can't do <Y> (don't have an [MagnaGarurumon]). However, as the hand is a private area, you are not required to verify if you have an MagnaGarurumon or not.
Q: If I only have 4 cards in my hand with [Hybrid] in their traits, can I activate this card's [Main] effect to place 4 cards from my hand under this Tamer without digivolving?
A: No, you can’t.
Q: Does this card's "as if this Tamer is a level 5 blue Digimon." apply even if you choose not to digivolve?
A: No, this card's "as if this Tamer is a level 5 blue Digimon." only applies if you are using its effect to digivolve into [MagnaGarurumon]. It does not keep applying afterwards.
Q: Will this card's inherited effect activate when my Digimon is returned to my hand?
A: Yes, it does.
Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when a card effect allows you to draw and trash card from your hand?
A: Yes, it will activate.
Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate if my card effect performs a digivolution and draws from its digivolution bonus?
A: No, it is not treated as drawing from an effect.

cards.name: Zoe Orimoto
cards.effect1:
[Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.
[On Play] You may search your security stack for 1 card with [Hybrid], or [Ten Warriors] in its traits, reveal it, and add it to your hand. If you added a card to your hand, <Recovery +1 (Deck)> (Place the top card of your deck on top of your security stack). Then, shuffle your security stack.
cards.effect2: [Opponent's Turn] All of your Security Digimon get +3000 DP.
ruling: Q: How do I activate this card’s inherited effect?

A: Some Digimon cards can digivolve onto Tamers. Digivolve such a Digimon onto this card, and it will become part of that Digimon’s digivolution cards, allowing you to activate this card’s inherited effect.
Q: If you have a [Hybrid], or [Ten Warriors] in their traits in Security, do you have to add it to your hand if you checked security?
A: No, you do not have to add it to your hand.
Q: Do I have to check the security?
A: No, you can choose not to look at your security. If you do not look at security you must still shuffle the security.

cards.name: J.P. Shibayama
cards.effect1:
[Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.
[Your Turn] When this Tamer digivolves into a green Digimon, reduce the memory cost of the digivolution by 1.
cards.effect2: <Piercing> (When this Digimon attacks and deletes an opponent's Digimon and survives the battle, it performs any security checks it normally would).
ruling: Q: How do I activate this card’s inherited effect?

A: Some Digimon cards can digivolve onto Tamers. Digivolve such a Digimon onto this card, and it will become part of that Digimon’s digivolution cards, allowing you to activate this card’s inherited effect.

cards.name: Kota Domoto
cards.effect1:
[Start of Your Turn] If you have 2 memory or less, set your memory to 3. 
[On Play] Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Add 1 card with [X Antibody] in its traits among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
cards.effect2: [Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Koichi Kimura

[On Play] <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck). Then, trash 1 card in your hand.

ruling: Q: How do I activate this card’s inherited effect?

A: Some Digimon cards can digivolve onto Tamers. Digivolve such a Digimon onto this card, and it will become part of that Digimon’s digivolution cards, allowing you to activate this card’s inherited effect.

cards.name: Flame Memory Boost!
cards.jpname: フレイム・メモリーブースト‼
cards.effect1:
[Main] 1 of your Digimon gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card) for the turn. Then, place this card in your battle area. 
[Main] <Delay> (Trash this card in your battle area to activate the effect below. You can't activate this effect the turn this card enters play.)
・Gain 2 memory.
cards.effect2: [Security] Place this card in its owner's battle area.

cards.name: Firedrake Strike
cards.effect1: [Main] Choose 1 of your Digimon with [Hybrid] in its traits. Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with DP less than or equal to the chosen Digimon's DP.
cards.effect2: [Security] You may play 1 [Takuya Kanbara] from your hand or trash without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Giga Storm
cards.effect1: [Main] Delete up to 2 of your opponent's Digimon with 8000 DP or less.
cards.effect2: [Security]  Activate this card's [Main] effect.

cards.name: Blue Hawaii Death
cards.effect1: [Main] For the turn, 1 of your Digimon gets +3000 DP and can also attack your opponent's unsuspended Digimon with no digivolution cards.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Starlight Velocity
cards.jpname: スターライトベロシティ
cards.effect1: [Main] You may play 1 Tamer card or 1 Digimon card with [Hybrid] in its traits from one of your Digimon's digivolution cards as a Tamer or another Digimon without paying its memory cost.
cards.effect2: [Security] You may play 1 [Koji Minamoto] from your hand or trash without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Tidal Wave
cards.effect1: [Main] Choose up to 2 Digimon cards in the digivolution cards of one of your Digimon and play them as other Digimon without paying their memory costs.
cards.effect2: [Security] Activate this card's [Main] effect.

cards.name: Ultra Turbulence
cards.jpname: ウルトラタービュレンス
cards.effect1: [Main] 1 of your opponent's Digimon and all of your opponent's Security Digimon get -3000 DP for the turn.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.
ruling: Q: I use this card, then, during a security check, I flip one of my opponent’s Security Digimon, whose DP is reduced to 0 by this card’s [Main] effect. Is the opponent’s Security Digimon deleted without a battle taking place?
A: No. Even if a Security Digimon’s DP is reduced to 0, they still battle the Digimon performing the security check.

cards.name: Electric Rush
cards.effect1: [Main] 1 of your Digimon gets +3000 DP for the turn. Then, if you have 3 security cards, unsuspend 1 of your Digimon.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Qualialise Blast
cards.jpname: クオリアライズブラスト
cards.effect1:
When this card would be used from your hand, its memory cost is equal to the number of cards in your security stack.
 [Main] 1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -3000 DP for the turn. Then, 1 of your [Rasenmon] gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card) for the turn.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.
ruling: Q: My security stack is empty. Can I use this card without paying any memory?
A: Yes. When your security stack is empty, this card’s memory cost is 0.
Q: I use this card to have an opponent’s Digimon get -3000 DP, then play a [Rasenmon]. Can I have that [Rasenmon] gain <Security Attack +1>?
A: No. You didn’t have a [Rasenmon] in play when you used this card, so it's too late to give it <Security Attack +1>.
Q: If I have 7 Security and a yellow tamer, can I use the effect of [BT6-112 BeelStarmon] to play it?
A: No, you cannot. This card's effect is only considered 7 "when you would use this card". It is not considered to have a use cost of 7 while in your hand.

cards.name: Thunder Laser
cards.effect1: [Main] If you have a Digimon with [Hybrid], or [Ten Warriors] in its traits in play, suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.
ruling: Q: Can I use this card when I don’t have a Digimon with [Hybrid], or [Ten Warriors] in play? If I can, what does the effect do?
A: You can use this card, but no effect will occur. This will still trigger any effects that trigger when you use Option cards, however.

cards.name: Dino Memory Boost!
cards.jpname: ダイノ・メモリーブースト‼
cards.effect1:
[Main] Suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon. Then, place this card in your battle area.
[Main] <Delay> (Trash this card in your battle area to activate the effect below. You can't activate this effect the turn this card enters play.)
・Gain 2 memory.
cards.effect2: [Security] Place this card in its owner's battle area.

cards.name: Mugen
cards.effect1: [Main] Suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon. That Digimon doesn't unsuspend during your opponent's next unsuspend phase.
cards.effect2: [Security] Suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon.
ruling: Q: Using this card's [Main] effect, can I prevent my opponent's Digimon from becoming unsuspended during my opponent's next unsuspend phase by applying this effect to it while it's suspended?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Metal Cannon
cards.effect1: [Main] Choose 1 of your Digimon with [X Antibody] in its traits. Then, <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck) for each of that Digimon's digivolution cards.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Pride Memory Boost!
cards.jpname: プライド・メモリーブースト‼
cards.effect1:
[Main] Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. You may play 1 black Digimon card with a play cost of 4 or less among them without paying its memory cost. Trash the remaining cards. Then, place this card in your battle area.
[Main] <Delay> (Trash this card in your battle area to activate the effect below. You can't activate this effect the turn this card enters play.)
・Gain 2 memory.
cards.effect2: [Security] Place this card in its owner's battle area.
ruling: Q: I use this card’s effect, but there are either no black Digimon cards with play costs of 4 or less among the revealed cards, or there is one, but I choose not to play it. Do I discard this card instead of placing it in my battle area?
A: No. Whether or not you play a Digimon with this card’s effect is irrelevant. You still place it in your battle area.

cards.name: Brave Metal
cards.effect1: [Main] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less. If you have a Digimon with 5 or more digivolution cards and [X Antibody] in its traits in play, you may delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon without [X Antibody] in its traits instead.
cards.effect2: [Security] Activate this card's [Main] effect.
ruling: Q: I don’t have a Digimon with 5 or more digivolution cards and [X Antibody] in its traits in its traits in play. Can I delete 1 of my opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less and [X Antibody] in its traits in its traits with this card's effect?
A: Yes, you can.

Q: I have a Digimon with 5 or more digivolution cards and [X Antibody] in its traits in its traits in play. Can I delete 1 of my opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less and [X Antibody] in its traits in its traits with this card's effect?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Calling From the Darkness
cards.effect1: [Main] Delete 1 of your Digimon. Then, return up to 2 purple Digimon cards from your trash to your hand.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.
ruling: Q: I use this card's effect to delete 1 of my purple Digimon. Can I then return that Digimon card to my hand with this card's effect?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: I use this card’s effect to delete 1 of my purple Digimon with an [On Deletion] effect and return it to my hand. What happens to the [On Deletion] effect?
A: The [On Deletion] effect is triggered, but it cannot activate because the Digimon card leaves the trash before that.
Q: Can this effect return Purple Digi-Egg cards from the trash to my hand, and then to the bottom of the Digi-Egg Deck?
A: No, Digi-Egg cards are not treated as Digimon cards.

cards.name: Schwarz Lehrsatz
cards.jpname: シュバルツ・レールザッツ
cards.effect1: [Main] For each Digimon with [Hybrid] in its traits and each Tamer you have in play, delete 1 of your opponents Level 5 or lower Digimon.
cards.effect2: [Security] Activate this card's [Main] effect.
ruling: Q: Does “For each Digimon with [Hybrid] in its traits in its traits and each Tamer you have in play, delete 1 of your opponent's level 5 or lower Digimon” mean that I can delete 1 of my opponent’s Digimon for each pair of [Hybrid] in its traits Digimon and Tamer I have in play?

A: No. The number of Digimon you can delete is equal to the total number of Digimon with [Hybrid] in their traits and Tamers you have in play. For example, if you have 2 Digimon with [Hybrid] in its traits in their traits and 1 Tamer in play, you can choose a total of 3 of your opponent’s Digimon.
Q: Can I attempt to delete less Digimon than the number of Tamers in play?
A: No, if there is a valid target and you have not deleted equal to the number of Tamers you must delete that target.

cards.name: Dead or Alive
cards.jpname: デッド・オア・アライブ
cards.effect1: [Main] Play 1 purple level 5 Digimon card from your trash without paying its memory cost. If there are 10 or more cards in your trash, you may play 1 Digimon card with  [Lucemon] in its name without paying its memory cost instead.
cards.effect2: [Security] Activate this card's [Main] effect.
ruling: Q: I have 10 or more cards in my trash. Can I use this card's effect to play a purple level 5 Digimon card?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: If I have 10 or more cards in my trash, can I play a Yellow Digimon card with [Lucemon] in its name?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: If I have 10 or more cards in my trash, can I play a Digimon card with [Lucemon] in its name from my hand?
A: No, you cannot. It must be played from the trash.

cards.name: Evolution Ancient
cards.jpname: エボリューションエンシェント
cards.effect1:
If you have a Digimon with [Hybrid] in its traits in play, you may use this Option card without meeting its color requirements.
[Main] Your level 4 Digimon can digivolve into 1 Digimon card in your hand with matching colors and [Ten Warriors] in its traits for its digivolution cost, ignoring its level.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.
engsets: Digimon Card Game Fest - Fest Set
ruling: Q: "If you have a Digimon card with [Hybrid] in its traits in play, you may use this Option card without meeting its colour requirement" how does this effect work, exactly?
A: If you have a Digimon with [Hybrid] in its traits in your battle area, you can use this Option card even if you don’t have a white Digimon or Tamer in play.

cards.name: Lucemon: Chaos Mode
cards.jpname: ルーチェモン：フォールダウンモード
cards.effect1:
Your [Lucemon] can digivolve into this card in your hand for a memory cost of 7, ignoring this card's digivolution requirements.
For every 10 cards in your trash, reduce the memory cost when playing this card from your hand by 3.
[On Play] [When Digivolving] Delete 1 of your opponent's Tamers or level 6 or lower Digimon.
ruling: Q: This card has an effect that has both [On Play] and [When Digivolving] timings. What does this mean, exactly?
A: It means the effect can be activated both [On Play] and [When Digivolving].

cards.name: Susanoomon
cards.effect1:
You may digivolve this card from your hand onto one of your Tamers as if the Tamer is a level 6 Digimon by placing 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with [Hybrid] in their traits from your hand and/or trash at the bottom of your deck in any order.
<Security Attack +2> (This Digimon checks 2 additional security cards)
[When Digivolving] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon.
ruling: Q: What color cards does this card’s digivolution requirement icon refer to?
A: This card’s digivolution requirement icon refers to all colors. Currently, this Digimon can digivolve onto a level 6 Digimon that’s red, blue, yellow, green, black, purple, or white.

Q: This card’s effect reads, “10 Tamer cards and/or cards with [Hybrid] in their traits in their traits from your hand and/or trash,” but does this mean I can only activate the effect by returning 10 cards in my hand or 10 cards in my trash?
A: No, you can mix and match cards from your hand and trash. As long as you return a total of 10 cards to the bottom of your deck, you can activate the effect.
Q: When this card adds a Tamer card to its digivolution cards, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?
A: No, it doesn’t.
Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 6 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: After a Tamer card ends up in this Digimon's digivolution cards, is that card affected by effects that trash digivolution cards?
A: Yes, it is. However, if the effect specifies that it trashes Digimon cards, DigiEgg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't affect Tamer cards.
Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?
A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve onto a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.
Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?
A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn.
Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with this Digimon during that same turn?
A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?
A: It's trashed.
Q: Can I activate this card's "placing 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with [Hybrid] in their traits from your hand and/or trash at the bottom of your deck" effect while this card is still in my hand?

A: No, you must reveal this card from your hand in advance. You must perform the "placing 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with [Hybrid] in their traits from your hand and/or trash at the bottom of your deck" part of the effect before the digivolution takes place, so you must reveal the card from your hand first. If it is revealed, it is no longer treated as being in your hand.
Q: Can I activate this card’s "placing 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with [Hybrid] in their traits from your hand and/or trash at the bottom of your deck" effect when I have no Tamers in play?

A: Yes, you can. In this case, you can’t digivolve even after performing the actions described by the effect. After revealing this card, it is trashed. Note that the game will not view this as you trashing a card in your hand.
Q: Can I activate this card’s "placing 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with [Hybrid] in their traits from your hand and/or trash at the bottom of your deck" effect but choose not to digivolve this card?

A: Yes, but if you do, this card will be trashed. You must have 10 cards in your trash and/or hand to reveal this card, but you can also do this without a Tamer in the battle area.The procedure is:
Reveal the Susanoomon to the opponent,
Place 10 cards on the bottom of your deck in any order,
Trash the Susanoomon.
